title: Literary Argument - unusual or mysterious origins

content.description:
Many works of literature feature a character whose origins are unusual or mysterious. Either from your own reading or from the list, choose a work of fiction in which unusual or mysterious origins shape a character and the character’s relationships. Then, in a well-written essay, analyze how these unusual or mysterious origins and their complex effect on the character or the character’s relationships contribute to an interpretation of the work as a whole. Do not merely summarize the plot.

In your response you should do the following:

Respond to the prompt with a thesis that presents a defensible interpretation.

Provide evidence to support your line of reasoning.

Explain how the evidence supports your line of reasoning.

Use appropriate grammar and punctuation in communicating your argument.

Beloved

Brave New World

Dracula

The English Patient

Frankenstein

Great Expectations

Grendel

The Iliad

The Importance of Being Earnest

Jane Eyre

Light in August

Macbeth

The Mayor of Casterbridge

The Metamorphosis

Middlemarch

No Country for Old Men

The Odyssey

Oedipus Rex

Orlando

Oryx and Crake

The Playboy of the Western World

A Prayer for Owen Meany

Their Eyes Were Watching God

Tom Jones

Twelfth Night

Waiting for Godot

Wuthering Heights
content.question: In a well-written essay, analyze how these unusual or mysterious origins and their complex effect on the character or the character’s relationships contribute to an interpretation of the work as a whole. Do not merely summarize the plot.

frqParts.text: In a well-written essay, analyze how these unusual or mysterious origins and their complex effect on the character or the character’s relationships contribute to an interpretation of the work as a whole. Do not merely summarize the plot.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Identify and describe what specific textual details reveal about a character, that character's perspective, and that character's motives.
